intro: Poa dives, commonly known as the blue grass, is a cool-season grass native to the northern regions of the United States and Canada. It is characterized by its fine, bluish-green blades and forms dense, low-growing turf. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for lawns and sports fields. Poa dives has a fibrous root system that helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion. It is also known for its ability to tolerate moderate foot traffic and recover quickly from damage.
